block.p: Amy Janet Rhodes, a daughter of Hiroko Yajima Rhodes and Samuel Rhodes of Englewood, N.J., was married last evening to Daniel Shea Froehlich, a son of Lynn Bush and David Froehlich, both of Doylestown, Pa. Judge Shira Scheindlin of Federal District Court in Manhattan officiated in the Snuff Mill at the New York Botanical Garden in the Bronx.
The couple graduated in 1996 from the University of Pennsylvania, the bride magna cum laude.

Amy Janet Rhodes, a daughter of Hiroko Yajima Rhodes and Samuel Rhodes of Englewood, N.J., was married last evening to Daniel Shea Froehlich, a son of Lynn Bush and David Froehlich, both of Doylestown, Pa. Judge Shira Scheindlin of Federal District Court in Manhattan officiated in the Snuff Mill at the New York Botanical Garden in the Bronx.
The couple graduated in 1996 from the University of Pennsylvania, the bride magna cum laude.

The bride, 26, will continue to use her name professionally. She is the director of artist management for Fine Arts Management in Brooklyn, which manages classical musicians and composers. Her father is the violist of the Juilliard String Quartet. Her mother is the violinist of the Mannes Trio and the chairwoman of the string department at Mannes College of Music in Manhattan.

The bridegroom, 26, is a deputy director of operations for the New York City Parks Department. His mother is the executive director of the Bucks County Planning Commission in Doylestown. His father is the executive director of the Wissahickon Valley Watershed Association, an environmental protection organization in Ambler, Pa.
